title.narrative: Etude sur les pratiques de l'Islam au Niger

description.narrative: Islam in Niger has undergone rapid changes since the advent of democracy in 1992. A great number of new religious associations have been born and new interpretations of islam been introduced as a result of both internal political dynamics and regional as well as international developments. In 2006 Denmark financed a research project, which mapped the situation in Niger at that point in time, and which serves as a base-line for the present study, which intends to document the latest developments including the effects of the rise of militant islam in the neighboring countries Nigeria, mali and Libya. The study shall be used to produce recommendations to Nigers state and civil society as well as to the international community as to how religious conflict and violent extremism meay be mitigated.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
